thread.title: Four Shiv Sena workers who were detained for disrupting Pakistani’s artist play sent to 14 days judicial custody
thread.title_full: Four Shiv Sena workers who were detained for disrupting Pakistani’s artist play sent to 14 days judicial custody

author: Wires English | India.com News Desk
title: Four Shiv Sena workers who were detained for disrupting Pakistani’s artist play sent to 14 days judicial custody
text:
Four Shiv Sena workers who were detained for disrupting Pakistani’s artist play sent to 14 days judicial custody By India.com News Desk on October 25, 2015 at 9:11 PM Comments 
Gwalior, October 25: Four Shiv Sena workers who yesterday shouted anti-Pakistan slogans and briefly disrupted a play performed by Pakistani nationals were sent to judicial custody on Sunday. 
A group of men who claimed to be Sena workers barged into an open air amphitheater where some Pakistani nationals were performing a show, shouted slogans, “Pakistan Murdabaad”, “Hindustan Zindabad” and “Jai Shri Ram”, reported a newspaper. A Lahore based Mass Group Foundation was playing their play, ‘Baanjh’, when the group of five-six men barged in and disrupted the show. 
According to the police, the men emerged from the show and shouted slogans. There was no police officials present at the spot. The one hour long show was called of in 10 minutes due to security concerns. 
Soon after the incident, police officials were called at the spot. Four Sena workers were arrested by the police after an official case was registered at a nearby police station. 
Sena workers also said that they will continue their protest until Pakistan stopped firing across the border. 
Earlier this month, Shiv Sena activists had on three occasions targeted events in Maharashtra featuring Pakistani artistes or officials. 
Sena workers in Mumbai attacked Sudheendra Kulkarni wil ink while he was about to launch a book written by former Pakistan foreign minister Khurshid Mehmood Kasuri. 
Sena also threatened to disrupt show of Pakistani ghazal singer, Ghulam Ali and demonstrated at the BCCI’s headquarter, last Monday. 
  25, 2015 9:11 PM Topics:
